newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end higher led by Laidlaw rally.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end higher led by Laidlaw rally.

text.p: CHANGE CHANGE
NIKKEI 18896.19 -549.81 LME CASH NICKEL US$6885 +130.0
CANDLR 1.3560 LME CASH ALUM US$1523.0 +5.0
CAN 30-YR 108.25 -1.30 FEB BRENT CRUDE US$24.58 +0.03
* Toronto stocks ended higher on Tuesday, led by sharp gains in transportation * Laidlaw Inc soars on US$2 billion deals * 112 million shrs traded worth C$1.5 billion
Toronto stocks ended higher on Tuesday, carried aloft by a sharp rally in transportation shares and an early start to the retirement savings season.
The TSE 300 Composite Index climbed 26.16 points to close at 5946.87 in heavy turnover of 112.9 million shares worth C$1.5 billion.

Advancing stocks outnumbered declines 496 to 463 with 282 issues unchanged. The transport group led 11 of 14 sub-groups higher, adding 272 points to close at a high of 6502.75. Investors drove Laidlaw Inc's shares to new heights after it announced two major waste and transportation deals late Monday.
Analysts said the annual influx of retirement savings money into equities appeared stronger than usual this year.

"Cash flows into mutual funds are running pretty strongly. In Canada, that seems to be a touch ahead of expectations so that is a fortifying factor," said John Kellett, vice-president of equities for Royal Bank of Canada.

Individual stocks have been stronger leaders than groups on the TSE recently. "It tends to be the specific story that gets people's attention, but the oils continue to do well and the banks have held most of their gains since June," he said.
--- HOT STOCKS ---
* Laidlaw Inc class B soared 1.80 to 18, a 52-week high, in brisk volume of 9.5 million shares. The company's class A stock gained 1.45 to a close at a high of 17.95.

Analysts applauded the US$1.12 billion acquisition of American Medical Response Inc. which will make Laidlaw the biggest ambulance operator in North America. It also announced plans to spin off its hazardous waste holdings into a new merged company with Rollins Environmental Services.
* Manitoba Telecom Services was also active, ending at 13.80 on 4.5 million shares after trading as high as 13.95. The stock was issued at C$13 a share.
((Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8100))
